sn22.56:5.3.pli: Ye kevalino vaṭṭaṁ tesaṁ natthi paññāpanāya.
sn22.56:5.3.en: For consummate ones, there is no cycle of rebirths to be found.

sn22.56:15.3.pli: Ye kevalino vaṭṭaṁ tesaṁ natthi paññāpanāyā”ti.
sn22.56:15.3.en: For consummate ones, there is no cycle of rebirths to be found.”

sn22.57:5.4.pli: Ye kevalino vaṭṭaṁ tesaṁ natthi paññāpanāya.
sn22.57:5.4.en: For consummate ones, there is no cycle of rebirths to be found.

sn22.57:17.4.pli: Ye kevalino vaṭṭaṁ tesaṁ natthi paññāpanāya.
sn22.57:17.4.en: For consummate ones, there is no cycle of rebirths to be found.

dn15:22.6.pli: Ettāvatā adhivacanapatho, ettāvatā niruttipatho, ettāvatā paññattipatho, ettāvatā paññāvacaraṁ, ettāvatā vaṭṭaṁ vattati itthattaṁ paññāpanāya yadidaṁ nāmarūpaṁ saha viññāṇena aññamaññapaccayatā pavattati.
dn15:22.6.en: This is how far the scope of language, terminology, and description extends; how far the sphere of wisdom extends; how far the cycle of rebirths proceeds so that this state of existence is to be found; namely, name and form together with consciousness.

dn15:32.11.pli: Yāvatā, ānanda, adhivacanaṁ yāvatā adhivacanapatho, yāvatā nirutti yāvatā niruttipatho, yāvatā paññatti yāvatā paññattipatho, yāvatā paññā yāvatā paññāvacaraṁ, yāvatā vaṭṭaṁ, yāvatā vaṭṭati, tadabhiññāvimutto bhikkhu, tadabhiññāvimuttaṁ bhikkhuṁ ‘na jānāti na passati itissa diṭṭhī’ti, tadakallaṁ.
dn15:32.11.en: A mendicant is freed by directly knowing this: how far language and the scope of language extend; how far terminology and the scope of terminology extend; how far description and the scope of description extend; how far wisdom and the sphere of wisdom extend; how far the cycle of rebirths and its continuation extend. It wouldn’t be appropriate to say that a mendicant freed by directly knowing this holds the view: ‘There is no such thing as knowing and seeing.’

mlDocs.title:
Long Discourses 15
The Great Discourse on Causation

ud6.8:5.7.pli: Ye ca kho te abhiññāya tatra ca nāhesuṁ, tena ca nāmaññiṁsu, vaṭṭaṁ tesaṁ natthi paññāpanāyā”ti.
ud6.8:5.7.en: Those who realize these things, who were not found there, who did not conceive by that, there is no cycle of rebirths to be found.”

sn44.6:7.3.pli: Taṇhāsaṅkhayavimuttassa, āvuso sāriputta, bhikkhuno vaṭṭaṁ natthi paññāpanāyā”ti.
sn44.6:7.3.en: For one who is freed due to the ending of craving, there is no cycle of rebirths to be found.”

mlDocs.title:
Linked Discourses 44.6
1. The Undeclared Points
With Sāriputta and Koṭṭhita (4th)

mn22:42.2.pli: Evaṁ svākkhāte, bhikkhave, mayā dhamme uttāne vivaṭe pakāsite chinnapilotike ye te bhikkhū arahanto khīṇāsavā vusitavanto katakaraṇīyā ohitabhārā anuppattasadatthā parikkhīṇabhavasaṁyojanā sammadaññāvimuttā, vaṭṭaṁ tesaṁ natthi paññāpanāya.
mn22:42.2.en: In this teaching there are mendicants who are perfected, who have ended the defilements, completed the spiritual journey, done what had to be done, laid down the burden, achieved their own goal, utterly ended the fetters of rebirth, and are rightly freed through enlightenment. For them, there is no cycle of rebirths to be found. …

The Simile of the Snake
